{"id":589962155,"lang":"java","time":"1Â month","timestamp":1637405569,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"2 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/589962155/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"40.1 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public double findMedianSortedArrays(int[] nums1, int[] nums2) {\n        int n1 = nums1.length;\n        int n2 = nums2.length;\n\n        int[] res = new int[n1 + n2];\n\n        int i = 0, j = 0;\n\n        while (i < n1 && j < n2) {\n            res[i + j] = (nums1[i] < nums2[j]) ? nums1[i++] : nums2[j++];\n        }\n\n        while (i < n1) {\n            res[i + j] = nums1[i++];\n        }\n\n        while (j < n2) {\n            res[i + j] = nums2[j++];\n        }\n\n        int n = n1 + n2;\n\n        if ((n & 1) == 0) {\n            return (double) (res[n / 2] + res[(n - 1) / 2]) / 2;\n        } else {\n            return (double) res[n / 2];\n        }\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays"}
